isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ADJUSTMENT

note.para: Check the end play on one countershaft at a time.

step1.para: Put the transmission in NEUTRAL (Figure 360).
Install Countershaft End Play Checking Tool ZTSE-4425 on the upper countershaft ( Figure 361).

figure.caption: Figure 361. Install Countershaft End Play Checking Tool

step2.para: Put the shaft plug adapter in position on the countershaft. Install and tighten the screws that fasten the adapter to the countershaft.
Install the (short) shaft plug with 5/16 inch threads into the adapter. Tighten the plug.
Install the 3/8 inch base into one of the mounting holes for the clutch housing.
Install the actuator arm so that the "forked" end of the arm is in the groove of the shaft plug.
Align the hole in the actuator arm with the hole in the base. Install the pivot pin.

note.para: Runout measurement will not occur when the output shaft is rotated if the dial indicator and the Countershaft End Play Checking Tool are correctly installed. If runout occurs, make sure the tip of the dial indicator and the alignment mark on the shaft plug are aligned.

step1.para: Install dial indicator so that the tip of the indicator is in the center of the shaft plug. Make sure the tip of the dial indicator is also aligned with the alignment mark on the shaft plug (Figure 362).
Install a torque wrench in the end of the actuator arm. The torque wrench must be installed in a straight line with the actuator arm ( Figure 362).
Measure the upper countershaft end play.

note.para: If you do not apply proper torque, repeat the procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 362. Install Dial Indicator and Torque Wrench

step2.para: Use the torque wrench to apply a force of 34 Nm (25 ft-lbs.) in one direction (Figure 363).
Put reference marks on the input shaft and main case. When the input shaft is rotated in this procedure, the "starting" and "stopping" positions of rotation must be in the same location.
Rotate the input shaft at least four (4) complete turns in a clockwise direction. Make sure the "starting" and "stopping" positions of rotation are at the same location ( Figure 363).
Set the dial indicator to zero (0).
Change the direction of force applied in step A to the opposite direction.
Rotate the input shaft at least four (4) complete turns in a counterclockwise direction. Make sure the "starting" and "stopping" positions of rotation are at the same location (Figure 364).
Record the reading on the dial indicator.

step1.para: The correct end play specification is 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006 inch).
If the reading is 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006) go to step 14.
For Design Level 1 Transmissions, if the reading is less that 0.051 mm (0.002 inch) or more than 0.152 mm (0.006), see steps 7 and 8.
For Design Level 2 Transmissions, if the reading is less than 0.051 mm (0.002 inch) or more than 0.152 mm (0.006 inch), see steps 9 through 14.
For Design Level 1 Transmissions, if the reading is 0.051 mm (0.002 inch) or less, check the following:

step2.para: Check the cover of the main countershaft for damage. Replace damaged covers. Repeat steps 1 through 5.
Check for dirt or other contaminants between the rear bearing cup and the case. Repeat steps 1 through 5.
Remove the auxiliary case and check that the cup for the main countershaft is correctly installed in the main case. Repeat steps 1 through 5.

step1.para: For Design Level 1 Transmissions, if the reading is more than 0.152 mm (0.006 inch), remove the 1.73 mm (0.068 inch) snap ring from the front bore of the main countershaft.
Use the reading to find the correct snap ring in the Snap Ring Table. Install the correct snap ring in the front bore for the main countershaft (Figure 365).
Repeat steps 1 through 5 to make sure the end play is correct. When the end play is correct, go to step 14.
Design Level 2 Transmissions: if the reading is less than 0.051 mm (0.002 inch), or there is no reading, move the cup 3 mm (0.125 inch) toward the outer surface of the case.

step2.para: Remove the Allen-head bolts and remove the retainer.
Use a yoke bar (puller bridge), washer and a long 5/16 inch x 18 bolt to move the cup (Figure 366).
After the cup is moved, go to step 13 (the procedure for if the reading is 0.020 inch or more).

figure.caption: Figure 366. Use Yoke Bar, Washer and Long Bolt to Move Cup

step1.para: Design Level 2 Transmission:if the reading is 0.178 to 0.279 mm (0.007 to 0.011 inch), refer to the following:

step2.para: Remove the Allen-head bolts and remove the retainer.
Remove the 0.127 mm (0.005 inch) shim.
Install the retainer. Install the Allen-head bolts. Alternately and evenly tighten the bolts to 14 to 16 Nm (120 to 140 in-lbs.).
Check the end play as described in steps 1 through 5 of this procedure.

step1.para: Design Level 2 Transmissions: if the reading is 0.305 to 0.356 mm (0.012 to 0.014 inch), refer to the following:

step2.para: Remove the Allen-head bolts and remove the retainer.
Remove the 0.191 mm (0.0075 inch) shim.
Install the retainer. Install the Allen-head bolts. Alternately and evenly tighten the bolts to 14 to 16 Nm (120 to 140 in-lbs.).
Check the end play as described in steps 1 through 5 of this procedure.

step1.para: Design Level 2 Transmissions:if the reading is 0.381 to 0.483 mm (0.015 to 0.019 inch), refer to the following:

step2.para: Remove the Allen-head bolts and remove the retainer.
Remove the 0.127 mm (0.005 inch) shim.
Remove the 0.191 mm (0.0075 inch) shim.
Install the retainer. Install the Allen-head bolts. Alternately and evenly tighten the bolts to 14 to 16 Nm (120 to 140 in-lbs.)
Check the end play as described in steps 1 through 5 of this procedure.

step1.para: Design Level 2 Transmissions: if the reading is 0.508 mm (0.020 inch) or more, refer to the following:

step2.para: Remove the Allen-head bolts and remove the retainer.
Remove and discard all the shims, including the original shims.
Install a new shim kit in the bore for the front countershaft bearing. Make sure the slots for the oil passage on the shims are aligned with the oil passage hole.
Install the retainer for the front countershaft bearings. Install the Allen-head bolts. Alternately and evenly tighten the bolts to 14 to 16 mm (120 to 140 in-lbs.).
Check the end play as described in steps 1 through 5 of this procedure.
Find the end play measurement determined in step 5 of this procedure in the End Play Measurement Table. Remove shims to get the specified end play of 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006 inch).
Check end play again. Make sure the front cup touches the retainer. If the reading is 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006 inch), the end play is correct. Refer to step 14.

step1.para: Repeat steps 1 through 5 and check the end play of the other main countershaft.
On Design Level 1 Transmissions: when the end play is 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006 inch) on each countershaft, repeat steps 1 through 5 on each countershaft to make sure the end play is correct.
On Design Level 2 Transmissions, when the end play is 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006 inch) on each countershaft, do the following:

step2.para: Remove the Allen-head bolts that fasten the retainer to the main case.
Apply Loctite #222 or equivalent to the threads of the bolts.
Install the bolts. Alternately and evenly tighten the bolts to 14 to 16 Nm (120 to 140 in-lbs.) (Figure 367).
Repeat steps 1 through 5 of this procedure to make sure the end play is correct.

figure.caption: Figure 367. Alternately and Evenly Tighten Bolts
